content:
Dabba the Mallian was a lay devotee of the Buddha, who was known for his remarkable generosity and devotion. He lived in ancient India during the time of the Buddha and was widely revered for his charitable acts and his generosity to both the Buddha and the monastic community.

It is said that Dabba the Mallian had the power of giving, which is considered a rare and precious quality in Buddhist teachings. He was able to share his wealth and resources with others freely and without hesitation, and he inspired others to follow his example. The Buddha praised Dabba the Mallian as an exemplar of the lay follower who lived a virtuous and generous life, and he is remembered in Buddhist tradition as a model of generosity and kindness.
